intro: Gomphrena hassleri, commonly known as the red gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spiky inflorescences that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Gomphrena hassleri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
